hero.headline: Vibe-Kanban: A Rust-Powered Task Manager Built to Supercharge Claude Code & Codex Workflows
hero.summary: A new Rust-based kanban board called vibe-kanban is trending on GitHub with 144 stars today, designed specifically to help developers get '10X more' out of coding agents like Claude Code, Codex, and other AI assistants. The tool provides structured task management optimized for AI-driven workflows.
hero.whyItMatters: As AI coding assistants become more sophisticated, developers need better ways to organize and delegate tasks to them. Vibe-kanban represents a growing category of tools that sit between the developer and the AI agent, providing the structure and context that helps agents work more effectively. This is the 'context engineering' approach in action.

topStories.title: Mole: A macOS Deep Clean Tool Hits #1 on GitHub Trending with 1,600+ Stars
topStories.summary: tw93's Mole project exploded to the top of GitHub trending today with over 1,600 stars in a single day. The shell-based tool deep cleans and optimizes Mac systems, resonating with developers tired of bloated system utilities.

topStories.title: Fresh: A Modern Terminal Text Editor Written in Rust
topStories.summary: A new terminal-based text editor called Fresh is gaining traction with 281 stars today. Built in Rust, it promises to be 'easy, powerful and fast' for developers who prefer terminal-based workflows.

topStories.title: Gemini 3 Flash Now Available in Gemini CLI with 78% SWE-bench Score
topStories.summary: Google made Gemini 3 Flash available in Gemini CLI v0.22.0, offering Pro-grade coding capabilities at lower latency and cost. The model achieves 78% on SWE-bench Verified, outperforming even Gemini 3 Pro for agentic coding tasks.

topStories.title: On LLMs in Programming: A Developer's Honest Assessment
topStories.summary: A thoughtful piece on Lobsters examining the role and impact of large language models in software development practices, sparking discussion about where AI assistance helps and where it falls short.

trendingRepos.name: tw93/Mole
trendingRepos.description: Deep clean and optimize your Mac. A shell-based system utility that removes junk files, clears caches, and optimizes performance.

trendingRepos.name: Shubhamsaboo/awesome-llm-apps
trendingRepos.description: Collection of awesome LLM apps with AI Agents and RAG using OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini and open-source models.

trendingRepos.name: sinelaw/fresh
trendingRepos.description: Text editor for your terminal: easy, powerful and fast. Built in Rust for performance.

trendingRepos.name: BloopAI/vibe-kanban
trendingRepos.description: Get 10X more out of Claude Code, Codex or any coding agent. A kanban board optimized for AI-assisted development workflows.

trendingSkills.name: Sisyphus Orchestrator
trendingSkills.description: Main orchestrator that manages background Skills, classifies requests, and delegates tasks across multiple agents for complex workflows.

trendingSkills.name: Memory Catcher
trendingSkills.description: Extracts insights from completed work and stores findings in Memory Lane for future reference. Enables persistent learning across sessions.

trendingSkills.name: Librarian Agent
trendingSkills.description: Specialized codebase understanding agent for multi-repository analysis, searching remote codebases and building comprehensive context.

trendingSkills.name: Cursor Rule Orchestrator
trendingSkills.description: Expert system for designing, structuring, validating, and deploying Cursor Rules for consistent AI-assisted development.

newMcpServers.name: database-server
newMcpServers.description: Comprehensive database server supporting PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite with natural language SQL query capabilities. AI agents can interact through both direct SQL and natural language.

newMcpServers.name: sqlite-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Transforms SQLite into an AI-ready database engine with text search, vector search, geospatial capabilities, and intelligent workflow automation.

newMcpServers.name: kubectl-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Enables AI assistants to interact with Kubernetes clusters via kubectl operations. Natural language cluster management and pod debugging.

newMcpServers.name: schemacrawler-ai
newMcpServers.description: Natural language interaction with database schemas. Ask questions like 'Explain the interest calculation stored procedure' and get detailed answers.

notableHooks.name: Auto-Commit on Stop
notableHooks.description: Automatically creates Git commits when Claude Code finishes a task, using the user prompt as the commit message. Reads the transcript to extract context.

notableHooks.name: Multi-Session Branch Manager
notableHooks.description: Isolates parallel Claude Code sessions into separate Git branches using shadow indexes. Each session commits to refs/heads/claude/<session-id> without affecting the working directory.

notableHooks.name: Desktop Notification Alert
notableHooks.description: Sends a macOS desktop notification with sound when Claude Code completes a task. Simple but essential for multitasking developers.

tuiTools.name: lazygit
tuiTools.description: Simple terminal UI for git commands. The most popular Git TUI with keyboard-driven efficiency for staging, committing, and branch management.

tuiTools.name: gitui
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal-ui for git written in Rust. Uses 30-40% less memory than Go alternatives with zero-cost abstractions.

tuiTools.name: gum
tuiTools.description: A tool for glamorous shell scripts from Charm. Build interactive prompts, spinners, and styled output for CLI tools.

tuiTools.name: dive
tuiTools.description: A tool for exploring each layer in a Docker image. Analyze and optimize container images directly from the terminal.

trendingVideos.title: Do my AI prompts waste energy?
Create Seamless AI Films from One Prompt (Consistent Characters & Scenes)
Claude Code Just Got The Ultimate Dev Shortcut (LSP Explained)
Day 105 - Vibe Coding an App Until I Make $1,000,000

highlights: LSP (Language Server Protocol) tool for go-to-definition, find references, and hover documentation
Terminal setup support for Kitty, Alacritty, Zed, and Warp terminals
Ctrl+t shortcut in /theme to toggle syntax highlighting on/off
Gemini 3 Flash support achieving 78% SWE-bench Verified for agentic coding
Pre-installed in Google Colab for headless and interactive use
MCP Resource Support: Discover, view, and search resources using @ command
TUI2 enhancements with normalized mouse wheel and trackpad scrolling
MCP OAuth login for streamable HTTP servers without feature flags
Fixed /undo command's destructive interaction with git staging

notableQuotes.quote: Context engineering is replacing prompt engineering as the new frontier of control. It's not about clever wording anymore—it's about designing environments where AI can think with depth, consistency, and purpose.
notableQuotes.author: KDnuggets Research

notableQuotes.quote: In testing of a dashboard TUI rendering 1,000 data points per second, the Ratatui version consistently used 30–40% less memory and had a 15% lower CPU footprint than the Bubbletea equivalent.
notableQuotes.author: Developer TNG

notableQuotes.quote: OpenAI's Skills in Codex draws directly from the Agent Skills standard, originally created by Anthropic and released as an open specification. Multiple platforms have integrated this standard, including Microsoft, GitHub, Cursor, and Goose.
notableQuotes.author: Dataconomy

prompt: Generated via /generate-news slash command. Claude fetches data from 9 sources in parallel (aggregated RSS feed, 7 web searches, GitHub trending via trotd, SkillsMP feed, Claude Code/Gemini CLI/Codex changelogs, Docker MCP catalog via mcp-find, YouTube trending API, Claude Code hooks docs, awesome-tuis list), deduplicates against the past 14 days of digests, then curates into structured JSON.
